ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Interesting bug in frontier import.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi there again, And, what causes the bug: F+ http://www.pmcbank.com/images/NRI-Banking.jpg LLR This crept into the import recovery file, a missing field. e.g.

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Interesting bug in frontier import.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=90724651; y=Fd19TskkPGe-zwjfKa9Zi9p0q9wlzf4LFmjYlUHzbU1c
X-Yahoo-Profile: lekash
From: John Lekashman <lekash@...>

Hi there again,
And, what causes the bug:

F+ http://www.pmcbank.com/images/NRI-Banking.jpg LLR

This crept into the import recovery file, a missing field.
e.g. (the next line:)
F+ http://www.pokupayte.ru/2003/04/ LLLE http://www.pokupayte.ru/

Now . . . why that happened, and some tool left off the referring uri.

Dunno that.  But failing mercilessly on such an error, not the right
thing.  So we shall see if that can be repaired.

John


On 8/28/14 9:49 AM, John Lekashman lekash@... [archive-crawler]
wrote:
>  
> 
> Hi there.
> Thought I would let you all know about a fine bug I found today in
> frontier import.
> 
> Follows the relevant log information.
> Essentially, starts an import from the action directory.
> Reads in 69M uris.
> Takes a null pointer exception.
> And, does it again, since the action file didn't complete.
> 
> Its kind of funny, this one got up to about 360M before I noticed it was
> looping and killed it.
> 
> Perhaps I shall file a jira issue on it, after I look more to see
> what caused the null. Reading a file just shouldn't do that.
> 
> John
>
